decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive permanents. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and maintain board presence through cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Urza's Saga. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts and card draw spells to generate card advantage and maintain a strong hand. The companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, provides additional value by allowing the player to recur small permanents and maintain a steady flow of resources throughout the game.

The key concept of the deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, disrupting the opponent's mana base, and generating card advantage. It focuses on using cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, Mental Misstep, and Force of Negation to prevent the opponent from resolving threats. It also utilizes disruptive lands like Strip Mine and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Additionally, the deck aims to generate card advantage through cards like Brainstorm, Dig Through Time, and Ancestral Recall, allowing the player to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent.

The deck is built around the concept of generating a large amount of mana and using it to cast multiple spells in a single turn, with the goal of creating a storm count (number of spells cast in the turn) high enough to win the game. The deck achieves this by incorporating cards that generate mana, such as Moxes and Tolarian Academy, and spells that provide card advantage and allow for efficient tutoring, such as Demonic Tutor and Mystical Tutor. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect its combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo card Doomsday to its full potential. The deck contains a mix of powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, along with cantrips like Preordain and Ponder to set up the perfect Doomsday pile. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Pact of Negation to protect the combo. The goal is to assemble the necessary cards, cast Doomsday, and set up a winning combination of cards that will lead to victory, often involving Thassa's Oracle as the finisher.

The key concept of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell, using Serum Powder to potentially start with a better hand. This allows for the recurring presence of creatures like Ichorid, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba, which can be brought back to the battlefield for free. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's game plan. Bazaar of Baghdad helps fuel the graveyard and generate card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful control spells and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck includes a variety of powerful and restricted cards such as Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Time Walk to gain card advantage and tempo advantage. It also includes a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and disruption cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Dress Down to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent's plays.

This deck is built around the goal of maintaining control over the game by employing various strategies. It contains a mix of powerful spells and artifacts, including powerful Moxes and a Black Lotus for mana acceleration. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will to counter opponent's threats. Additionally, there are cards like Flusterstorm and Spell Pierce to disrupt opponent's spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and resilience to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to assert control over the game through its powerful cards and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay while also disrupting the opponent's strategy. It utilizes hatebears (cards that impose restrictions on the opponent) to slow down the opponent's game plan. It also includes mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats. The deck aims to control the battlefield with creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, making it difficult for the opponent to cast spells. It also has some card advantage and resilience with Seasoned Dungeoneer and Loran of the Third Path. The deck includes a few powerful mana artifacts like Mox Sapphire and Black Lotus to ramp up mana production. Overall, the deck combines aggression and disruption to give the opponent a hard time.

The key strategy of this Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad, Stinkweed Imp, and Serum Powder, triggering abilities of creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. This allows for the efficient casting of powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Hollow One while leveraging the graveyard synergy of cards like Golgari Thug and Ichorid. Protection and disruption comes in the form of Force of Will, Mental Misstep, and Force of Negation, while cards like Creeping Chill provide additional life gain and damage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the game using a combination of card advantage, disruption, and efficient creatures. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate advantage and gain extra turns. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, it has creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and White Plume Adventurer to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent, ultimately leading to victory.

This deck focuses on the synergy between the cards Oath of Druids and Show and Tell. The goal is to use these cards to cheat powerful creatures, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier, into play as early as possible. The deck also includes various tutors and cantrips to ensure consistency and find the necessary combo pieces. Control elements are provided through counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, as well as disruptive cards like Strip Mine. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration cards, such as Moxen and Lotus Petal, to ramp into its game-winning plays quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Moxen, and Grim Monolith, and then use cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Paradoxical Storm to draw a lot of cards and generate even more mana. This allows the player to cast high-cost spells and activate powerful abilities, such as using Tinker to search for and play an artifact like Time Vault or The One Ring. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive mana generation and card draw to execute its combo gameplay.

This deck focuses on using the "Dredge" mechanic to fill the graveyard with cards and then utilize them to quickly assemble a powerful combination of creatures. It includes cards like Grief, Ichorid, and Narcomoeba that can be put into the graveyard from the hand, as well as cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug that have the Dredge ability. The deck also utilizes cards like Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad to further manipulate the graveyard. With cards like Prized Amalgam and Hollow One, the deck aims to rapidly bring back multiple creatures and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck is focused on aggressive play and disrupting opponents through hatebears. The key concept is to use hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down opponents and hinder their strategies. The deck also utilizes cards like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Tomb to generate fast and efficient mana. Additionally, it includes powerful artifacts and legendary lands like Mox Sapphire and Karakas to further enhance its disruptive strategy. The goal is to apply early pressure while simultaneously disrupting opponents, ultimately leading to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures and midrange control elements to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman to deal damage, while also utilizing disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to counter the opponent's spells. Additionally, it also includes powerful cards for card advantage and tempo like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The deck's overall strategy is to maintain control of the game and apply pressure on the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive play and disruptive strategies to hinder the opponent's game plan. The key concept revolves around using hatebears, such as Anointed Peacekeeper, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Chancellor of the Annex, to slow down the opponent's progress. Additionally, it utilizes mana acceleration through powerful artifacts like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to maintain a fast-paced offense. The deck capitalizes on resource denial by incorporating Wasteland, Strip Mine, and Karakas to hinder the opponent's lands and key creatures. The goal is to establish early control and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Archon of Emeria.
